cyclone.name: NICOLE
cyclone.current_location: about 415 miles ENE of the northwestern Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn west-southwest toward the north-western Bahamas Tuesday, make landfall along the east-central Florida coast Wednesday night, then curve north-northeast across Florida and Georgia toward the Carolinas and off the Mid-Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: east-central coast of Florida (near or north of West Palm Beach–Vero Beach area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Hallandale Beach to north of Ocean Reef, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning Hallandale Beach FL to Altamaha Sound GA; Storm Surge Warning North Palm Beach FL to Altamaha Sound GA including mouth of St. Johns River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coastline from Florida through Georgia and the Carolinas inside the forecast cone
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are possible late Thursday into Friday with a peak 34-kt probability of 14% at the port (cumulative 23%).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding is possible; current surge warning stops south of Savannah, so significant >3-ft surge is not yet indicated for the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain with local maxima near 5 inches expected across southeast Georgia as the storm passes Friday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large swells and dangerous rip currents along the Georgia coast could disrupt vessel movements and pilot boarding operations.
